result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy P Sheedy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Entry into Locked Coin Box, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.125(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $50 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy P Sheedy in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. Atty Pelrine makes sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy P Sheedy

Prior: 916 Quincy St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
No contact direct or indirect with EZ Stop.

Defendant Jeremy P Sheedy in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
